meanings.sent1: The electrophotographic process creates clear images.
meanings.sent2: The electrophotographic printer produced high-quality photos.
meanings.sent3: The electrophotographic camera captured the moment perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like an electrophotographic machine, storing memories with precision.
meanings.sent5: The electrophotographic technology revolutionized the printing industry.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the process of creating an image using electricity and light.
meanings.sent1: The electrophotographic method combines electricity and light to form pictures.
meanings.sent2: The electrophotographic technique is used in modern photography.
meanings.sent3: The electrophotographic art installation lit up the room with creativity.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like an electrophotographic flash, brightening up the entire scene.
meanings.sent5: The electrophotographic process illuminated the beauty of nature in the photographs.

meanings.definition: Involving the use of electrically charged particles to form an image on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The electrophotographic display projected images using charged particles.
meanings.sent2: The electrophotographic technology printed documents with precision.
meanings.sent3: The electrophotographic experiment sparked interest in the scientific community.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like electrophotographic sparks, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The electrophotographic process etched intricate designs on the paper.
